summary: The concept of "strip" within the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks pertains to the establishment of technical regulations governing the importation and surveillance of certain products. This regulation, as outlined in various agreements, requires member states to cooperate in levying duties on imports originating from third countries. The Council and Commission have established ceilings on the annual tonnes of products that can be imported, ensuring compliance with the abovementioned protocols. Exemptions may apply to specific situations, particularly for socialist republics like Yugoslavia. The regulation, effective from July to December, provides a structured approach to managing economic activities within the community.
